isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - LUBRICATION, SEALERS AND MAINTENANCE INTERVALS - LUBRICATION INTERVAL TABLES

svcsubsecinfo.para: The following tables are organized by the "CTS Master Service Manual" Service Groups so that the Service Group (section of the CTS Manual) can be easily accessed when more information is desired to perform any of the following lubrication services. The following twelve Service Groups require lubrication: 02: Front Axles, 03: Suspension, 04: Brakes, 05: Steering, 06: Prop Shafts, 08: Electrical, 09: Front End, 11: Clutch, 12: Engine, 13: Transmission, 14: Rear Axles, 16: Cab.

Please read the SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS referenced in the "LUBE TYPE/LUBE NOTES" column of the lubrication tables. The reference letters are defined at the end of the LUBRICATION INTERVAL TABLES section in this SPECIAL INSTRUCTIONS section.

table.title: 02 FRONT AXLE: TABLE 02-1: EATON-SPICER NON DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: FRONT AXLE TABLE #1 OF 6: EATON-SPICER NON DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
1-1. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE: CHECK OIL LEVEL
1-2. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE: CHANGE OIL

table.title: 02 FRONT AXLE: TABLE 02-2: FABCO DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: FRONT AXLE TABLE #2 OF 6: FABCO DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
SEALED AT THE FACTORY, NO LUBE REQUIRED THROUGHOUT LIFE OF PART
SEE NOTE 4 AT END OF THIS TABLE.
AT EACH CHASSIS LUBE OR AT EVERY 1,000 MILES OR 1,600 KILOMETERS
2-6. SPINDLE INNER BEARINGS: SDA-1200 ONLY, PACK GREASE
ABOVE 32 deg F (0 deg C) use MIL-L-2105B, SAE 140, MIL-L-2105C or 80W-140.
BELOW 32 deg F (0 deg C) use MIL-L-2105B, SAE 90, MIL-L-2105C or 80W-90

table.title: 02 FRONT AXLE: TABLE 02-3: INTERNATIONAL-SPICER NON DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: FRONT AXLE TABLE #3 OF 6: INTERNATIONAL-SPICER NON DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
3-4. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE: CHECK OIL LEVEL
3-5. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE: CHANGE OIL

table.title: 02 FRONT AXLE: TABLE 02-4: MERITOR DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: FRONT AXLE TABLE #4 OF 6: MERITOR DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
4-2. STEERING KNUCKLES, U-JOINTS AND OUTER DRIVE SHAFT SEALS
4-6. CHANGE PETROLEUM OIL: HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY

table.title: 02 FRONT AXLE: TABLE 02-5: MERITOR NON DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: FRONT AXLE TABLE #5 OF 6: MERITOR NON DRIVE AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS:PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
5-2. BALL STUDS ON STEERING ARM, TIE ROD ENDS AND DRAG LINK
5-3. WHEEL BEARINGS: ON HIGHWAY: GREASE TYPE, REPACK
5-4. WHEEL BEARINGS: ON/OFF HIGHWAY: GREASE TYPE, REPACK
5-5. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE, CHECK OIL LEVEL
5-6. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE: ON HIGHWAY, CHANGE OIL
5-7. WHEEL BEARINGS: OIL TYPE: ON/OFF HIGHWAY: OIL CHANGE

table.title: 02 FRONT AXLE: TABLE 02-6: SPICER DRIVE AXLE MODEL S-9000 LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: FRONT AXLE TABLE #6 OF 6: SPICER MODEL S-9000 LUBE INTERVALS (NAVISTAR CODE 02064)

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
6-1. TRUNNION BEARINGS AND AXLE SHAFT U-JOINTS
6-2. DIFFERENTIAL CARRIER: BREAK-IN DRAIN: PETROLEUM OIL

table.title: 03 SUSPENSION: TABLE 03-1: SUSPENSION LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: SUSPENSION TABLE #1 OF 1: SUSPENSION LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: SPECIAL INTERVAL NOTE: Make the suspension lubrication intervals for the following maintenance the same as your vehicles engine oil change intervals.

table.title: 04 BRAKES: TABLE 04-1: BRAKE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: BRAKE TABLE #1 OF 1: BRAKE LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST.
1-2. Rail Slide Disk Brake Caliper & Anchor Plate
1-3. Pin Slide Disk Brake Anchor Plate, Guide Pins, Boots & Pin Bores
1-4. Pin Slide Disk Brake Caliper Bore Seal Land
1-7. Hydraulic Brake Booster Pump (w/o P.S.), Check Level
1-10. Brake Camshafts and Manual Slack Adjusters
1-11. Brake Pedal to Brake Valve Pivot

table.title: 05 STEERING: TABLE 05-1: STEERING LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: STEERING TABLE #1 OF 1: STEERING LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST WHEN GIVEN A CHOICE BELOW.
1-1. POWER STEERING, CHECK PUMP FLUID LEVEL
1-2. POWER STEERING, SHEPPARD, CHANGE FLUID AND FILTER IN RESERVOIR FOR (SEVERE OFF-HIGHWAY APPLICATIONS)
1-3. POWER STEERING, SHEPPARD, CHANGE FLUID AND FILTER IN RESERVOIR
1-4. POWER STEERING, ROSS TAS, (SEVERE OFF-HIGHWAY APPLICATIONS), CHANGE FLUID AND FILTER IN RESERVOIR
1-5. POWER STEERING, ROSS TAS, CHANGE FLUID AND FILTER IN RESERVOIR
1-6. STEERING GEAR INPUT SHAFT BEARING CAP: SHEPPARD
1-7. STEERING GEAR (MANUAL), GEMMER, CHECK FLUID LEVEL

table.title: 14 REAR AXLE: TABLE 14-2: INTERNATIONAL / SPICER REAR AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: REAR AXLE TABLE #2 OF 3: INTERNATIONAL / SPICER REAR AXLE LUBE INTERVALS

NOTE: BREAK-IN CHANGE HAS BEEN ELIMINATED

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST.
HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY

table.title: 14 REAR AXLE: TABLE 14-3: MERITOR DIFFERENTIAL LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: REAR AXLE TABLE #3 OF 3: MERITOR REAR AXLE LUBE INTERVALS
NOTE: THE FOLLOWING INTERVALS APPLY TO DIFFERENTIALS AND WHEEL ENDS.
INTERVALS ARE PRESENTED IN THE FOLLOWING ORDER AND FORM:

entry.para: BREAK-IN CHANGE FOR 100% PETROLEUM OIL ONLY
HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY
HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY,
HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY
NOT WITH OIL PUMP, NOT WITH FILTER
HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY
WITH "ADVANCED LUBE", NOT WITH OIL PUMP, NOT WITH FILTER
HEAVY DUTY ON AND OFF HIGHWAY
WITH "ADVANCED LUBE", OIL PUMP AND FILTER

table.title: 16 CAB: TABLE 16-1: CAB LUBE INTERVALS

para.emph: CAB TABLE #1 OF 1: CAB LUBE INTERVALS

entry.para: INTERVALS: PERFORM THE SERVICE AT WHICHEVER INTERVAL COMES FIRST.
Check Fluid Level in Cab Hydraulic Lift Pump, 9800
